stem: Based on the client's vital signs and Nurses' Notes from 08:00 to 11:00, which finding most concerns the nurse regarding the client's safety?

options.text: The stability of the hemoglobin level.
The slight increase in core temperature.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content: Post-op Stage: Status post femoral artery catheterization. 10:45: Client reports abdominal pain and feels 'weak'. Dressing to groin is dry.

rationale.correct: The trending reduction in MAP (from 90 to 65) alongside tachycardia (84 to 118) is indicative of compensated to decompensated hypovolemic shock, likely due to retroperitoneal hemorrhage after femoral access.
clinicalPearls: A dry dressing DOES NOT rule out internal hemorrhage after femoral procedures.

questionTrap.trap: Ignoring the BP because the dressing is dry.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Always prioritize vital sign trends over physical external findings in post-catheterization hemorrhage.
